Thomas Fire The Thomas Fire is a late season (December) fire, which was part of the 2017 California wildfires season. It was started from a strong Santa Ana wind event and has since (as of December 5, 2017) grown over 50,000 acres (~50 square km). It has grown into the neighboring Ventura, California and has destroyed over 200 homes. There has been one reported death and one reported injury in the area. See the main article for more details.
